full_summary:
# ITQ Notification for Data Collection Modernization (DCM)

## Overview
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is publishing a notification for the Data Collection Modernization (DCM) Invitation to Qualify (ITQ). This announcement encompasses the solicitation number WS4105045039 and is aimed at vendors interested in participating in the DCM project.

## Key Dates

*   **Publication Date**: January 26, 2024
*   **Tender Closing Date**: December 31, 2024, at 2:00 p.m. (EDT)
*   **Expected Contract Start Date**: To be determined

## Project Overview
The DCM project seeks to modernize data collection processes and must be bid on through an open competitive process. Bidders will be required to provide a technical and price submission.

## Trade Agreements
The PSPC has declared this solicitation to be eligible under the following trade agreements:

*   World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
*   Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
*   Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
*   Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
*   Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
*   Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
*   Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
*   Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)

## Regions of Opportunity
The PSPC will not specify a region for bidders to focus on.

## Regions of Delivery
The DCM project will be delivered within the National Capital Region (NCR).

## Contact Information
For any questions or concerns, please contact Beauvais Lefort, Melanie (SPAC/PSPC) at melanie.beauvaislefort@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

## Additional Information
All documentation related to the ITQ can be found at the following URL: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18629004?extsite=MTg2MjkwMDRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==.

You can also contact the PSPC directly for any additional information you may require.
